title: Sophie's Daily Routine
description: Follow Sophie through a typical day in Paris! Learn to talk about daily routines, tell time, and use reflexive verbs to describe your day from morning to night.
objectives: Use reflexive verbs (se réveiller, se laver, s'habiller)
Talk about frequency (always, often, sometimes, never)

episodes.title: Une Journée Typique
episodes.content:
Sophie's alarm clock rings. "Dring dring!" It's 7:00 AM. She opens her eyes slowly.

"Je me réveille à sept heures," she mumbles sleepily. I wake up at seven o'clock.

She gets out of bed and walks to the bathroom. First, she takes a shower. "Je me douche," she says, turning on the water. The warm shower helps her wake up fully.

After her shower, Sophie brushes her teeth and gets dressed. "Je me brosse les dents et je m'habille." She chooses a comfortable outfit for work - black pants and a blue sweater.

In the kitchen, Sophie makes her breakfast. She prepares coffee - "Je prépare du café" - and toasts some bread. While eating, she checks her phone and reads the news. "Je prends mon petit déjeuner à sept heures et demie." I have my breakfast at 7:30.

At 8:15, Sophie leaves her apartment. "Je quitte l'appartement à huit heures et quart." She takes the metro to work. The journey takes about 20 minutes.

Sophie arrives at the office at 8:45. "J'arrive au bureau à neuf heures moins le quart." She greets her colleagues: "Bonjour tout le monde!"

Her workday is busy. She has meetings, writes code, and collaborates with Thomas and the team. At noon, they take a lunch break. "Nous déjeunons à midi." Sophie usually goes to a nearby café or brings a sandwich.

The afternoon passes quickly. Sophie works on her projects, answers emails, and has video calls with clients. At 6:00 PM, it's time to go home. "Je finis le travail à six heures."

On her way home, Sophie sometimes stops at the grocery store or bakery. "Quelquefois, je fais les courses." Sometimes I do the shopping.

At home, around 7:30 PM, Sophie prepares dinner. She likes to cook simple French dishes she's learned. "Je prépare le dîner et je mange vers huit heures." I prepare dinner and eat around 8 o'clock.

After dinner, Sophie relaxes. She might read a book in French - "Je lis un livre" - or watch a French TV series to practice. "Je regarde la télé." Sometimes she calls her family in New York.

Around 10:30 PM, Sophie starts getting ready for bed. She takes another shower, puts on her pajamas, and sets her alarm for the next day.

"Je me couche à onze heures," she says, climbing into bed. I go to bed at eleven o'clock. She's tired but happy. Tomorrow will be another good day in Paris.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Wake-up Time
exercise.instructions: What time does Sophie wake up?

question.content: At what time does Sophie wake up?

content.explanation: Sophie says: 'Je me réveille à sept heures' - I wake up at seven o'clock.
content.hint: Listen for when her alarm rings.

exercise.title: Match Reflexive Verbs
exercise.instructions: Match the French reflexive verbs with their English meanings.

exercise.title: Match Daily Activities
exercise.instructions: Match the French activities with their English translations.

content.hint: Think about activities throughout the day.

exercise.title: Complete: I wake up at...
exercise.instructions: Complete the sentence about waking up.

content.translation: I wake up at seven o'clock.

exercise.title: Arrange: I get dressed
exercise.instructions: Put the words in the correct order.

content.explanation: 'S'habiller' is a reflexive verb. 'Pour le travail' means 'for work'.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Arrival Time
exercise.instructions: When does Sophie arrive at the office?

question.content: What time does Sophie arrive at work?

content.explanation: Sophie says: 'J'arrive au bureau à neuf heures moins le quart' - I arrive at the office at a quarter to nine (8:45).
content.hint: 'Moins le quart' means 'minus a quarter' or 'quarter to'.

exercise.title: Complete: Frequency adverb
exercise.instructions: Complete the sentence with the correct frequency word.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Bedtime
exercise.instructions: What time does Sophie go to bed?

question.content: At what time does Sophie go to bed?

content.explanation: Sophie says: 'Je me couche à onze heures' - I go to bed at eleven o'clock.

exercise.title: Sophie's Daily Routine
exercise.instructions: Complete the summary of Sophie's typical day.

content.text: Sophie wakes up at {blank1} AM and takes a {blank2}. She has {blank3} at 7:30. She leaves her apartment at {blank4} and takes the {blank5} to work. She arrives at the office at {blank6}. At noon, she has {blank7} with her colleagues. She finishes work at {blank8} PM. In the evening, she prepares {blank9} and eats around 8 PM. She goes to bed at {blank10} PM.
content.hint: Review Sophie's schedule throughout the day.

exercise.title: Complete: Time expression
exercise.instructions: Complete the time expression.

content.text: Je prends mon petit déjeuner _____ sept heures et demie.
content.hint: This preposition is used for specific times.

speakers.name: Narrator
speakers.description: Story narrator with warm, engaging voice

episodes.audioStyle: This is a narrative story with a warm, calm tone. The narrator reads with natural pacing, creating an immersive storytelling experience.

episodes.title: Le Weekend vs La Semaine
episodes.content:
Thomas: Salut Sophie! Ça va?

Sophie: Salut Thomas! Oui, ça va bien. Et toi?

Thomas: Bien, merci! Dis-moi, tu te lèves toujours si tôt?

Sophie: En semaine, oui. Je me réveille à sept heures pour le travail. Mais le weekend, c'est différent!

Thomas: Ah oui? Tu fais la grasse matinée le weekend?

Sophie: Exactement! Le samedi et le dimanche, je me lève vers dix heures. C'est merveilleux!

Thomas: Ha ha! Moi aussi! Et qu'est-ce que tu fais le weekend?

Sophie: Le samedi matin, je fais souvent du jogging. Ensuite, je vais au marché pour acheter des fruits et des légumes frais.

Thomas: C'est bien! Tu vas à quel marché?

Sophie: Au marché de la rue Daguerre, près de chez moi. C'est très sympa. Et toi, qu'est-ce que tu fais le weekend?

Thomas: Le samedi, je fais du sport aussi. Je joue au football avec des amis. L'après-midi, je vais souvent au cinéma ou je lis.

Sophie: Tu aimes lire? Moi aussi! Qu'est-ce que tu lis en ce moment?

Thomas: Un roman policier français. C'est intéressant mais un peu difficile pour toi, je pense. Tu lis en français?

Sophie: Oui, mais des livres plus simples. Je lis des livres pour enfants! C'est parfait pour apprendre.

Thomas: Bonne idée! Et le dimanche, tu fais quoi?

Sophie: Le dimanche, je me repose. Je prends un long petit déjeuner, je regarde des films, je téléphone à ma famille en Amérique. C'est ma journée calme.

Thomas: Ça a l'air bien! Moi, le dimanche, je déjeune toujours chez mes parents. C'est la tradition familiale.

Sophie: C'est mignon! Ta famille te manque pendant la semaine?

Thomas: Un peu, oui. Mais on se voit tous les dimanches, alors ça va. Et toi, ta famille te manque?

Sophie: Oui, beaucoup. Mais on s'appelle souvent par vidéo. La technologie, c'est génial!

Thomas: Absolument! Bon, il est midi. On déjeune ensemble?

Sophie: Avec plaisir! Allons-y!

speakers.name: Sophie
speakers.description: An American woman talking about her routine

episodes.audioStyle: A casual, friendly conversation between colleagues discussing their daily and weekend routines. Both are relaxed and interested in each other's lives.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Weekend wake-up
exercise.instructions: When does Sophie wake up on weekends?

question.content: What time does Sophie get up on weekends?

content.explanation: Sophie says: 'Le samedi et le dimanche, je me lève vers dix heures' - On Saturday and Sunday, I get up around 10 o'clock.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Saturday activity
exercise.instructions: What does Sophie do on Saturday mornings?

question.content: What does Sophie often do on Saturday mornings?

content.explanation: Sophie says: 'Le samedi matin, je fais souvent du jogging' - On Saturday morning, I often go jogging.

exercise.title: Match Frequency Words
exercise.instructions: Match the French frequency adverbs with their English meanings.

content.hint: These words describe how often you do something.

exercise.title: Match Weekend Activities
exercise.instructions: Match the French activities with their English translations.

exercise.title: Complete: On weekends
exercise.instructions: Complete the phrase about weekends.

content.text: Le _____, je me lève vers dix heures.
content.translation: On weekends, I get up around 10 o'clock.

exercise.title: Arrange: I often go jogging
exercise.instructions: Put the words in the correct order.

content.explanation: 'Faire du jogging' means 'to go jogging'. The frequency word 'souvent' typically comes after the verb.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Thomas's Sunday
exercise.instructions: What does Thomas do every Sunday?

options.text: He has lunch with his parents

content.explanation: Thomas says: 'Le dimanche, je déjeune toujours chez mes parents. C'est la tradition familiale' - On Sunday, I always have lunch at my parents'. It's a family tradition.

exercise.title: Complete: What are you reading?
exercise.instructions: Complete the question.

content.text: Qu'est-ce que tu _____ en ce moment ?
content.translation: What are you reading right now?

exercise.title: Weekend Routines
exercise.instructions: Complete the comparison of weekday and weekend routines.

content.text: During the week, Sophie wakes up at {blank1} AM for work. On weekends, she sleeps in and gets up around {blank2}. On Saturday mornings, she goes {blank3}. Then she goes to the {blank4} to buy fresh produce. Thomas plays {blank5} with friends on Saturdays. On {blank6}, Sophie relaxes and calls her family. Thomas has {blank7} at his parents' house every Sunday. Both Sophie and Thomas enjoy {blank8} - Sophie reads children's books in French while Thomas reads French detective novels.
content.hint: Review the dialogue for details about their routines.

exercise.title: Expression: Faire la grasse matinée
exercise.instructions: What does this expression mean?

question.content: What does 'faire la grasse matinée' mean?

content.explanation: 'Faire la grasse matinée' literally means 'to make the fat morning' but it means 'to sleep in' or 'sleep late' on weekends or holidays.
content.hint: It's something people enjoy doing on weekends.
